forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. South southeast wind around 14 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the day unfolds in Downtown San Francisco, a somber cloak of rain embraces the city, casting a gray hue over the landscape. The familiar silhouettes of the bridges and skyline are shrouded in clouds, where the sunlight, usually so eager to peek through, remains a distant memory. With temperatures settling comfortably yet coolly around 55 degrees, the air feels thick with moisture, heavy with expectation. A brisk wind from the southeast weaves through the streets, adding a chill that seeps into layers of clothing, urging layers of warmth and waterproof attire.

The forecast promises more rain, with conditions unlikely to brighten; instead, expect the sky to remain overcast throughout the afternoon and into the evening, where the rain might intensify, delivering further amounts that could transform streets into rivers. This isn’t a day meant for the outdoors, but rather an invitation for cherished comforts—perhaps curling up with a good book by a window, sipping on something warm. Alternatively, it might be the perfect time to explore the cozy alcoves of local cafes, where the world outside seems distant and less urgent. As the light fades and the clouds deepen, remember to dress for warmth; a sturdy raincoat, a cozy scarf, and water-resistant shoes will be your steadfast companions as you navigate this wet urban tapestry.
